p: As favipiravir was effective in cell culture, its effectiveness in animals infected with influenza virus must be confirmed. We first observed the prevention of a lethal influenza infection. Oral administration of favipiravir was significantly effective in alleviating influenza infection in mice ( Furuta et al., 2002), and its efficacy was characterized under various conditions. We are convinced that favipiravir will be developed as an influenza drug for humans after the confirmation of its therapeutic activity in two species of animals, mice and ferrets, infected with influenza virus.
